column4: SO a proxy server is something that is used to bypass firewalls etc to view webpages... Is there anyway to set up my Home computer (using Ubuntu) as a Proxy server so I can access restricted pages from my laptop (also on Ubuntu)
easiest way would probably be to run privoxy on your home computer
Would my home computer have to be dedicated to doing this?
nah, privoxy doesn't take much resources
Is it difficult to set up?
it worked out of the box for me, if memory serves
yes, I believe the package name is privoxy
and this will let me bypass their web restrictions right?
assuming they haven't blocked outgoing connections to for example port 8888, yes
Where does privoxy install by default I cant figure out where to open it xD
it runs as a daemon at system startup, by default
InitHello.... Oh so that means its running now that its installed... Great but now how do I set up my laptop to use it? xD
ooh ... do you have a static IP at home?
I think I need to set one up still... I had one before I reinstalled Ubuntu

well, static IPs and/or dyndns services are beyond the scope of this channel, but what you want to do is tell your browser to use your home IP and port (search /etc/privoxy/config for 'listen-address' to find the port) as a proxy
you cant help me do it in a Private chat?
